113311.content:
He couldn't help but frown at the bizarre sensation that something was... off. Whatever it was, it was very subtle, but it definitely wasn't right. As he pushed himself up off the bed and rose to his full height, he paused. The doorframe wasn't that short. It simply wasn't. Had... Had he... Had he grown? He shook his head. It was absolutely absurd! He was a fully grown adult now, he wasn't supposed to be growing anymore. It had to simply be a trick of the mind, it had to be. However, before he could consider that matter further he was distracted by the voice of Felicity. "Foxy! What... Since when did... How? I mean, your tail!" She gasped, the fog of sleep clearly having been blown away by the shock of seeing her husbands missing appendage firmly reattached to his body. He immediately whipped around and realised that she was right! His tail had grown back! Could it have been the chemicals from last night? As his mind raced, he forced himself to keep a somewhat straight face. "Oh! Yes, the tail! Um, gee, I guess it had results like no one had expected..." He trailed off, realising that there was no way he could keep his mid-night adventure secret with this. His only chance now was to try and minimise the damage, so to speak.

Felicity blinked, cocked her head, furrowed her brow and stared at him for a moment. "Wait, what had results? And, more importantly, why didn't you tell me?" She snapped. He couldn't really blame her for her irritation. "Er, well, ah geez. This is going to make me sound so dumb, but, well, I was embarrassed. I was worried it wouldn't work, and I didn't want to humiliate myself, so..." He trailed off, trying to think of how to continue before Felicity stepped in. "So... you've been going out at night, haven't you?" She asked in a manner that made it perfectly clear that she knew it was the truth. He grimaced, knowing that there was no way he could deny it. "Yes." He nodded slowly, looking towards the floor. He heard her sigh deeply, an emotional sigh that he knew meant bad news on the horizon. "Were you at least planning on telling me at some point?" She asked, to which he immediately jumped up. "Of course! Of course I was, I wasn't going to keep this a secret from you forever! It just, well, happened so fast!" He said. It wasn't even a lie really, in a way. She paused, looking away. "Foxy..." She started softly. "Foxy, we need to talk about this." There it was. "But, not now. Not while Ash and Kris are here, they'll be heading out soon. We can talk about this when they're gone." She suggested, to which Foxy couldn't argue with. That was already far more generous than she had to be, not just with him but with the boys. "Okay, that sounds like a plan." He agreed, looking towards the door.

"Foxy?" Came Felicity's voice again, this time more confused. "Are you... are you bigger? I mean, it seems like you're a little taller... and your clothes look a bit tighter." She asked, prompting him to look down and realise that maybe he really was bigger. His clothes really did look tighter. Was that... was that muscle definition outlined in his shirt? He was glad he was looking away as he shook his head. "No, no. Probably just looks like it, now that I've got my tail back!" He grinned, finishing with his trademark whistle, relieved and impressed at how well he'd hidden his shock.

With that casual deflection, he quickly dashed into the bathroom and jumped into the shower. As he turned the water on, he yelped at the freezing cold. He'd been so disoriented, he hadn't even waited for the water to warm up. He shook his head with an irritated sigh and simply stood there, as he tried to puzzle out what was going to happen now. Felicity was furious with him, there was no denying it. He could tell so clearly it was as if she had written it in bold letters in front of him. He hated to admit it, but he was certainly not in control of this. Felicity could go anywhere, from screaming at him all the way to divorce. He couldn't even bring himself to find her at fault, she was right. She was absolutely right, this was all his fault. He closed his eyes and grimaced, he loved Felicity, he loved Ash, he loved Kris. He loved all of them dearly and deeply, but he just wasn't a good family man. He was born to be a cunning, smooth, silver-tongued conman, but that lifestyle simply wasn't sustainable in later life, nor was it cohesive to family life. He ran a paw over his muzzle. At least the water was warm now. He snatched the bar of soap up and got to work. He couldn't stay in here all morning. As he got to cleaning his fur, he paused as he ran over his abdomen. That was muscle. There was no way around it, that was definitely muscle. He had muscle. It wasn't a full-blown eight-pack or even a six-pack, but there was absolutely some trace of muscle there. He'd always been in good shape, he had to be, but he'd never been defined. He briefly worried if there were going to be side effects from this, but he shook the thought away. He had his marriage on the line right now, that was far more important.

"Dad! C'mon! I need to go!" Came Ash's cry from behind the door, jolting him from his misery. "Ah! Uh, sure thing, I'll be out in a minute!" He yelled back, rinsing his fur out and reaching for a towel.

Making sure that the towel was firmly wrapped around him and obscured the view of his abdomen, he quickly stepped out, seeing Ash standing by the door, evidently agitated. "Ah, hey Ash! I see your mother let you go before her, well, bathroom's free now, it's all yours!" He smiled, making sure to put a bit more warmth into his greeting. If things went bad, he didn't want Ash's memories of him to be tainted by harsh words or indifferent actions. "Thanks, dad." Ash said quickly, dashing in after him. He paused, staring at the door. He felt like Ash had been looking at him strangely as if he had noticed the difference in height too. He brushed it off. It was morning, Ash needed the bathroom, that was all there was to it. Now he was just projecting his fears. He let out a sigh as he turned and walked back to his room.

As he slipped through the door, Felicity nodded and gave a quiet greeting, to which he responded in turn. Okay, well, she wasn't screaming in incandescent rage at him, so that was a positive sign. Hopefully. He sat down on the edge of the bed, cringing slightly as he felt the springs compress under his weight. It wasn't even that much, Felicity probably didn't even notice. He just couldn't shake the feeling, however. He was bigger. He simply couldn't deny it anymore, he was bigger. He'd grown at least a couple of inches and had probably put on twenty pounds, not to mention he'd grown his tail back. He'd been lucky his towel had hidden his tail from Ash, now really was not the best of times to try and explain how he had regrown a missing appendage overnight, especially when he didn't even know how it had happened! As far as he'd known such a thing was impossible, even with intensive, aggressive medical therapy. He wanted to ask the man how such a thing could possibly happen, especially given that the chemicals he'd been doused in were apparently supposed to be for plant use, not animals! Biology simply didn't work like that. Did it? He shook his head again. It wasn't as if he'd know, and he could hardly go out and ask him, not least because he was a human and he was a fox.

He reached for his clothes, deciding that given the circumstances, something light and looser would be better suited. Pulling out a pastel blue shirt and grey slacks, he slipped the slacks on, grimacing as they became momentarily stuck around his waist, before with a forceful tug, they pulled up. He was briefly worried that he might have torn them in some way, but let out a quiet sigh of relief when he saw that - although tight around the waist and calves - they still fit. He picked up his shirt and pulled it over his head, sliding his arms though the holes, stiffening in concern when he experienced some difficulty. However, he managed to squeeze through, although his nerves faired much poorer than his clothes. As if he didn't have enough to worry about! He shook his head and began buttoning the shirt, grimacing at how the buttons seemed smaller, although it was likely because the buttons were smaller. Well, rather he was bigger and the buttons were smaller compared to his fingers. He could still hardly believe it, he was bigger!

Gah, this was all just so bizarre! He was bigger, taller, and also at risk of serious marital problems. All because he'd snuck out in the middle of the night, just because he couldn't control his curiosity and his urge to be out in the night, slipping past security systems and guards. All because he couldn't shake the need for a thrill. Now he was going to pay a price for it, and he still didn't know what that price would be. He grimaced, building up his courage to simply ask Felicity what this would mean, but when he turned, she was gone. He blinked, whipping around to see that he was alone in the room. He strained his hearing and could faintly pick up the sound of the shower. Ah, that was it. He'd simply been so preoccupied with his own musings and thoughts, he hadn't even noticed her walk by. He felt a twinge at that thought, feeling a rush of guilt at the thought that that might be a metaphor for his own selfishness.

He lowered his head down, staring at his knees in misery. Why couldn't he have just had this big moment of self-reflection earlier, before all of this? He'd have happily kept going without his tail in exchange.

He shook his head and steeled himself. He still had to get through the morning without breaking down under the stress. This was his fault. He owed it to Felicity to at least face it like a responsible, mature adult.

With a grunt, he pushed himself up off the bed and walked to the door. Time to face what may come. He could only hope that Ash and Kris didn't get too suspicious.

11331111.content:
Foxy gasped, darting forward and grasping the man under his arms. His weight nearly brought him crashing to the ground with him. His muscle mass had certainly increased and while he hadn't had much of a chance to test it, he would be willing to bet quite a significant sum that his strength had improved as a direct consequence. However, his strength could only do so much when he was off-balance. He let out a groan as he struggled to keep the man from smacking straight into the floor, gently easing his unconscious form to the floor.

Once the man was laid out on the hardwood floor, Foxy carefully stepped over his body, reaching over and closing the door. This was already bad enough, the last thing he needed was some random visitor coming up and spotting him. He looked down at the man, grimacing slightly. He should have expected something like this. How else was a human going to react to a human-sized fox strolling up to the house and talking to them? He sighed, shaking his head. Well, better get him somewhere a bit more comfortable than the floor for when he woke up.

Sliding his arms under his shoulders, Foxy grunted as he began to haul the man into the living room, stopping in front of the sofa. That should do. Hauling the man into a sitting position so that he was resting against the sofa, he began to haul him up. It was surprisingly easy however, all things considered. It wasn't a cakewalk, but it was certainly no slog either. As he got his upper body onto the sofa, he paused, looking down over his body. He shook his head, letting out one of his trademark whistles. He was in pretty good shape now, if he did say so himself! He was now sporting traces of muscle around his abdomen and his chest was slightly more defined than it had been before. He chuckled to himself as he reached down for the man's legs. Well, the height was obviously an issue, but getting his tail back and putting on some muscle? It wasn't all bad. Well, then again, he was here, instead of home...

He let out a breath, running a paw across his forehead. He sat down on the armchair across from the sofa and took a proper look around the room for the first time. It was quite a nice house to be fair, although it was quite different from what he was used to, given that he was used to homes being built into trees, holes, dams, and pretty much everywhere else that could use the nature around it without needing to build actual buildings. It kept them from being spotted and it meant that they were much more protected from things like storms and rain. There could be so much rain sometimes. He smiled softly at the thought as he looked out the window for a moment before turning back to the room. The hardwood floor's lighter tone was a nice contrast with the darker red of the wallpaper and it gave the room a comfortably spacious feeling, although the fact that the beige sofa and armchair ensemble were positioned against the perpendicular walls helped too. The TV was positioned in the corner atop the stand. Not much to say about it, although the bookcase was more interesting. A quick glance over it showed various movies and shows, but a large portion of the shelves were taken up by textbooks on Biology, Chemistry, Horticulture, Agriculture and Biochemistry and even a few on physiology. He let out a murmur of approval. This guy was clearly very intelligent to be knowledgeable in so many topics. Of course, given that he'd made a serum or formula or something that made him grow like this, well, it wasn't that surprising really.

He looked over at the human, who was still draped over the sofa, unconscious. He frowned, his fingers dancing uneasily. He was certainly no doctor, his knowledge was more rooted in strategic thinking, navigation and avoidance and manipulation of security systems rather than medicine, first aid, and neurology. He'd only fainted though, having caught him before he could hit the floor, so he strongly doubted that he had a brain bleed or a concussion or whatever. So there was that at least.

He spotted the TV remote on the table sat next to the armchair he had sat down in. He leant over to pick it up, the chair creaking lightly as he did so. He froze, ears perking as he looked down at the chair, holding his breath. However, the chair did not protest any more. He let out the breath he had been holding, shaking his head as he let out a chuckle. He was a bit too anxious about his new size. He was the size of a human - a towering giant compared to any fox, but completely within the usual range for a human, so of course, the furniture would still hold his weight. He grabbed the remote and examined it, musing over whether or not to actually turn it on. On one hand, it would probably help ease the tension quite a bit, but on the other hand, would it not be a bit disrespectful? To simply sit down and start watching TV in the home of someone you had shocked into a faint?

However, his musings were interrupted by a soft, quiet groan. He jumped, dropping the remote with a clatter that made him wince. However, it seemed it wasn't as loud as he had thought, either that, or the man was still not fully awake and aware yet. He hesitated leaping forth for fear of startling the man back into unconsciousness. Instead, he tentatively stepped forward, stopping when he was just outside of his field of vision.

He wasn't even entirely sure if they wanted to see him again in the first place. All he could do was hope, but full reconciliation was unlikely if not impossible. He just couldn't change himself. He lacked something, willpower maybe? He grimaced and shook his head sorrowfully. There was nothing he could do now but get dressed. Pushing his morose thoughts to the back of his mind, he reached down and hooked the boxers over his left foot and then his right foot, the massive digits splayed across the floor. He paused, looking around at the room. A human's room. He let out a breath, this time of awe. It was still unbelievable that he was human sized now, things were so similar, yet he couldn't completely adjust. His foot now would have probably covered his entire body at his previous size.

He ran a hand over his muzzle, still attempting to come to terms with this new reality. Remaining silent for a few minutes, he realised that he simply didn't have any idea how react yet. The whole situation was too alien and too complex to really think it all through. There was misery at his loss, elation at having his tail back and his newfound musculature, all mixed in with a combination of joy and fear at his overall growth. He was no scientist, that much he would openly admit, but even he knew that something so drastic in such a short amount of time simply wasn't possible. Yet, here he was, as tall as a human and as muscular as an athlete. If it wasn't possible, then it couldn't be happening. Right? That was how it worked, how reality worked, wasn't it? He shook his head and pulled his boxers up. He wasn't getting anywhere fast with this. Hopefully Robert could fill him in, he surely knew more about science than he did. Rising from the bed as he pulled his boxers up over his backside, he grabbed the pants; they were canvas pants, regular fit at that, so they would hopefully accommodate his powerful legs. He dropped his arms, putting the pants back on the bed when he noticed they covered his legs, and looked.

They were massive - the complete opposite of what they had been before. Where his legs had once been slender with sleek muscles, they were now huge, broad pillars of incredible strength, the muscles bulging impressively. He whistled in awe, unable to suppress his amazement. Bending his left leg at the knee, he stared intently as his quadriceps swelled outwards and his calves followed suit, flexing to the point where he couldn't even get his hand around them. Leaning back up he sat down on the bed again, stunned. As he looked up, he froze, spying a mirror in the corner. He'd been so deep in his thoughts he hadn't even noticed at first. Standing up and walking over, he looked at the full body mirror being almost fully filled with the muscular body of a tall, humanoid fox. Stretching one leg forward, he watched excitedly as his muscles engorged, chuckling softly to himself. He was huge. He'd never had this kind of strength before, not even in his youth. He had to test this out sometime. He hadn't even checked out his torso or his arms. He glanced down at them, but before he got lost in his own awe, he shook his head, moving back to pull his pants on. Thankfully the fabric allowed his impressive legs to slide in neatly, although they were slightly tight around the legs. Thankfully, they weren't so tight as to be restrictive or painful, and after he slipped his tail through the hole, he moved onto the shirt. Rather, he made to move onto the shirt before trailing off as he caught sight of his arms.

Much like his legs, his arms were absolutely enormous. While before they had been slim and slender, now they were huge and muscular; they were as thick as drainage pipes and could probably lift and swing one like a whackbat with ease. Rotating his arm to get a better look, he clenched his hand into a fist and flexed. He only held the pose for the briefest of moments before he dropped the flex out of pure shock. The muscle was easily the size of a basketball. He'd never had... never in his entire life had he ever had any sort of muscle mass even anywhere near half of that. Not even when he was a young fox. He flexed again, letting out a whistle as he watched the bicep swell outwards. Holding the pose, he tentatively reached over with a paw and slowly gripped the muscle, marvelling at how massive it was - so massive in fact, that he couldn't even get his hand around it properly. He dropped the flex again, slower this time, half-wanting to continue checking it out. With his new, substantially larger size, he couldn't help but suspect that that single bicep probably had more muscle mass than he had in his entire body before all of this happened. He couldn't stop himself from grinning. Felicity had broken up with him for a completely justifiable reason - he just couldn't control his reckless impulses. Yet, at least for now, he had a silver lining, something that would distract him from the situation, even if it wouldn't solve it in any way. Shaking his head with a breath of amusement, he reached for the shirt.

It was a very basic garment, with no design or pattern. The fabric of the plain light blue shirt was thin, but stretchy, which was immensely beneficial. Sliding in a thick arm, he shivered slightly at the sensation of the slightly cold fabric brushing against his fur. He slid the other arm in and rolled his shoulders, noting that it was a little bit tight around there. He couldn't really complain though - Robert looked quite slender in build, if he did any sort of exercise it was most likely cardio. His smaller frame reminded him of what his body used to be like before... well, before... this. Now he was built less like a professional burglar, but more like an amateur athlete, with his powerful limbs, firm pectorals and rigid abdominals, which his fingers ghosted over as he began to do up the buttons. As he reached closer to the top, the shirt became progressively tighter. It wasn't constrictive or uncomfortable though, if anything it was a very enjoyable feeling, the constant, subtle reminder of his newfound musculature. As he did up buttons over his chest, he took in a breath, involuntarily grinning at the tightness. Despite everything with Felicity and the boys and his life in general, at least he did have this going for him. If he got the chance to shrink back down, he wouldn't mind keeping the muscles.

At the thought of his body, he looked down at his torso, murmuring quietly at the sight. His pectorals were immense, jutting out at least an inch. Beneath the clean fabric and soft fur, the thick muscle was firm, powerful, unyielding. Before, when he simply been slender but fit, his chest had felt somewhat squishy, whereas now, there was no give to his chest. At first, he suspected he simply wasn't pushing hard enough, but even after he started to apply some more serious pressure, all he could feel was the steel-like muscle. He paused, his mind reeling in awe. Never in his wildest dreams had he ever even imagined something like this could even be remotely possible. He briefly mused that it was supposed to be impossible, although he supposed that as far as the average human was concerned, him and the other animals in general, should be impossible as they were anyway. Most people thought that they were more like that wolf rather than... well, what they were.

His gaze drifted back to the mirror, catching sight of his stomach. His hand fell back to the bed as his jaw fell open. Of course, he'd noticed that he was now impressively muscular, but until now he hadn't had a chance to sit down and examine himself in any great detail, with breaking up with Felicity and leaving the house and then ending up here, he simply hadn't had the time. While he'd got a quick look over himself when he'd burst out of his clothes, now he could really see his body in perfect detail, which was only made more impressive with the fact that the definition was visible through his clothes. No longer was his stomach smooth and flat, now it was adorned with a breath-taking set of prominent abdominal muscles. He raised a paw, pulled up the shirt and rapped on the firm 8-pack, letting out an astonished chuckle at how tough it was. He'd felt it, but there was no real trace of discomfort.

Letting out a sigh of wonder, he slid his shirt back down, pushing himself up. He was slightly surprised at the lack of vertigo, although he supposed that the furniture being scaled up with him helped take some of it away. As he considered his height, he raised a paw and reached towards the ceiling. Much like with his own home, it was probably a foot or so away. Yet, despite the similarity, it was eerie to consider that if he went back to his old home, he'd probably only be able to squeeze a single paw in. At the height of a human, he obviously wasn't going to dwarf the tree, but the main living area would surely be filled with nothing but fox. It was as disconcerting to consider as it was wonderful. He paused at that, but had little time to consider it before his mind moved back to Felicity and the boys. He shook his head forcefully. Not now.

He could think about that later.

For now, he had someone to talk with.

"You drank this, didn't you?" He asked anxiously, to which Foxy stammered, trying to answer before giving up and simply nodding.

Deciding to be honest, he was upfront and straightforward, resolving to leave no detail out. "I was out exploring and I found your house. You know how I mentioned that I thrive on the thrill of sneaking into places? Well, I hadn't done any sort of fancy infiltrations lately, so when I saw your house, I jumped at the chance. It wasn't that dramatic though, I mean, you left your front door open." He began, to which Robert frowned anxiously, shuffling on his feet. He was guessing that he'd found that after he'd made his escape. "Still, I went in, and saw a light on at the top of the stairs, so I went in to investigate and I found you sitting at your desk, talking to yourself. I crept up close by, and ended up getting a full dose of whatever was in there straight to the muzzle. So... I drank it all down right there and then. It was either that or most likely choke." He explained, raising a paw before letting it drop down.

Robert stared blankly at the vial in his hands before slowly shaking his head, as if in a daze. "I... so that's where it all went." He said softly. Foxy could only nod awkwardly. "Yeah." Robert blinked slowly, like he was waking up from a deep sleep. "I... I don't understand. This is... it's essentially... it's supposed to be for plants! I don't get it. How did that work? It... it shouldn't work! Should it?" He wondered aloud. Before Foxy could try and offer any suggestion, he remembered that Robert was the expert between the two of them, so with Robert's bewilderment, it certainly didn't inspire particularly great confidence. However, before he could figure out a way to voice his concerns in a manner that wouldn't come across as insulting, Robert seemed to be struck with a flash of inspiration. "Of course! That's it! Ugh, obviously! It can't affect plant growth, it affects cell growth! That's the only way it can work, it mustn't be specific to plants, it must be general! Otherwise it wouldn't have done anything, it'd be like drinking chlorophyll in the hopes to photosynthesize!" He exclaimed excitedly, before pausing abruptly, starting at the vial in his hand with a mix of fear and caution. "I... I better be careful with these. I don't know if these'll affect humans too, but they might well. Don't want to take that chance." Quickly depositing the vial back in its secure place, he turned back, staring Foxy in the eye.

Foxy shifted his stance as he digested Robert's words before something came to mind. "Wait, hang on a minute here. I'm a little bit confused. So, did you just... not know that that's what it did?" He asked, bewilderedly. Robert gave a slight nod as he gestured towards his set-up with a sardonic expression. "No, I didn't. I know, I know, sounds stupid, but you have to remember, I'm not exactly swimming in cash right now. I..." He trailed off, shaking his head morosely. "Ah, never mind. Look, you gotta realise that I just don't have the funds for a professional set up. I mean, you were listening to me go on about my plans, you should know, right? I was thinking of using plants from my parents' greenhouse!" He sighed, to which Foxy frowned, nodding. "True, I do remember something about that very thing actually. I'm just a little surprised that you found something so..." He trailed off, doing the little wild paw gesture. "...different, with a set-up like this." He admitted, to which Robert shrugged his shoulders. "I see your reasoning, but at the same time, this isn't unheard of. I mean, Thomas Edison is known as a great inventor - although he was more of a businessman - but he knew nothing about science. He literally achieved all his discoveries by sheer brute force and trial and error. Even before then, Ignaz Semmelweis - a doctor, he discovered germ theory long before it was mainstream. Ah, poor guy, he got driven out the community for it too, even though he could prove a benefit, but couldn't explain it." He lamented.

Foxy nodded awkwardly, not knowing any of these names. They'd never taught a lot of human history in school. Dispelling the confusion, he turned his thoughts back to the topic at hand. "Okay, so... you just... happened to stumble on something that's completely new and no one ever thought was even possible before?" He asked, still slightly skeptical.

Robert nodded. "Yeah, pretty much. I know, I know, sounds really weird, but that seems to be the case." He mused, scratching his head. Foxy took in a deep breath, closing his eyes as he tried to make sense of the bizarre situation he'd found himself in. Robert couldn't help but glance away bashfully as the buttons of his shirt strained against the thick musculature of his chest. Foxy let out that breath, his broad shoulders dropping as the tension in his frame vanished. "Alright. Alright. Okay. So... I'm a giant now. I'm a giant... well, I'm a giant and I've got more muscle that I did even when I was in my younger years..." He sighed, bringing a paw to the bridge of his muzzle. "Do you have any idea how to reverse this? Or at least stop this?" He asked, almost pleading in his tone. Robert turned his gaze to the floor, his expression forlorn. "I'm sorry. I don't. I had no idea it even worked yet, I have no idea how I'm going to reverse it, or even stop it." He admitted.

Foxy's face fell as he covered his face with a paw. He grit his teeth in a grimace, a frustrated growl bubbling up in his throat. "Ah... cuss." He snarled. Robert flinched at the irritated exclamation. "I'm sorry, I really, really am. I can try to look up what might counteract the components and see if they work?" He suggested, to which Foxy sighed and nodded calmly. "Yeah, sounds good. Sorry, I'm just frustrated, with what's happened since this." He morosely lamented. Robert nodded sympathetically. "I understand. I'll get on that. Plus, if that doesn't work, I can try things in combination and if that doesn't work, well... we'll think of something if that comes. But, we've got a lot of time before then and we've got a good plan in place I think!" He said, hoping to reassure the older fox. It seemed to work, as Foxy withdrew his paw and nodded. "Are you okay?!" Kristofferson asked, only to swallow hard and gawk in astonishment at what he saw. Ash had become gigantic! The once tiny fox had dramatically risen to twice his size, and was just as amazed as his cousin.

"What... happened to me..?" Ash groaned, dazed but regaining awareness, "Why are you so small?"

"I'm not small," Kristofferson said, his voice full of worry, "You grew!"

"What??"

Indeed, the tree was roughly half as tall as it had originally appeared. He might not have been the brightest student in class, but Ash knew that trees didn't grow underground. The pair studied it in silence, as if acknowledging the presence of something magical. Whatever it was, it was a strange thing, and its small, banana-like fruit was quite a sight. Ash began to reach for one when Kristofferson threw out his arms and yelled, "What are you doing? Don't touch that!"

But it was too late. The enormous fox had plucked the fruit and was turning it over in his palm.

"Relax," Ash said dismissively, "The damage is already done. Besides, what if it's the key to making me little again?"

Ash felt like he was grinning inside. "Little again." He was no longer 'little'. He was big. Huge, even. Even his father, the "Fantastic" Mr. Fox would look up to him. He felt great! In fact, when he really focused on it, his whole body was pleasantly tingling. Is this what it was like to feel powerful? He'd always been particularly slender, lacking any muscle mass to speak of, but this was different. Noticing for the first time that his size change had also endowed him with an above-average physique, he scanned the toned definition of his forearm and flexed his bicep.

"I feel cussing fantastic," Ash beamed.

"Ash..." Kristofferson gasped, "You're still growing!"

Ash couldn't help but smile. "Yeah! I'm finally going to--"

"This isn't good at all, Ash. We've got to get you out of here and above ground! Come on! Through the crack, follow me!"

Normally cool under pressure, Kristofferson was visibly shaken. He maneuvered gracefully through the crack in the wall and started to run before suddenly realizing he'd left his cousin behind and doubled back. Ash was doing his best, and failing miserably, to squeeze through. "Cuss it!" Ash growled, and spit, "I can't make it!"

"Um..." Kristofferson thought, "Well, you're really big now. Try pushing on it."

"I am!"

Just then, as Ash gave it all his might, the bricks gave in and crumbled outward, giving him enough space to break through. Now roughly three times his usual size and growing, the young fox panted and wiped his brow. "Wow. This is crazy."

"The closest way out is over here," Kristofferson said, gesturing into the dark.

Ash hesitated. What would he do, once he was safely in the open? His folks would have a meltdown if he went home like this. He was huge, but not gigantic, not to mention that the tingling he'd felt had weakened. Maybe his growth spurt would stop, then he and his (considerably smarter) cousin could figure out how to shrink him back before anyone else could see. Ash glanced at the strange fruit he'd taken and considered his options.

"Let's go!" Kristofferson yelled.

What should he do?

For one thing, his feet were hanging off the edge of the bed, and his nose was substantially closer to the ceiling than before. For another, he felt an uncomfortable tightness around his chest and waist. Looking down at himself, he saw that his pajama shirt and pants had been stretched out considerably, a substantial gap between them revealing his stomach.

And what a stomach it was! Kristofferson had always been an athletic fox, making sure to stay in shape with his dad using karate and yoga, but he had yet to develop any substantial musculature -- well, that is, until now. His abs now seemed to have a well-defined six pack, rippling and bulging in places they had never done so before. It had to be too good to be true.

As he gradually became more awake, he noticed a paw resting against those strong, pronounced ab muscles. Looking over, he saw his cousin was still asleep, his arms wrapped around Kristofferson in a way that seemed more than platonic, though Kristofferson couldn't say it was entirely unwelcome. As his eyes moved up and down Ash's body, Kristofferson was stunned to notice that the shorter fox seemed to have changed overnight as well, and in much the same way.

Unlike Kristofferson, Ash slept shirtless, so the effects the fruit had on his body were much more visible at a glance. Not only was he now sporting a healthy six-pack of his own, but his chest seemed to have buffed up as well, his pectoral muscles firm and large, below a broad set of shoulders and next to large, powerful arms. Ash's boxers, loose the night before, now were almost skin-tight, and Kristofferson could clearly make out a pronounced bulge in between the red fox's legs. Looking down at himself, he quickly realized that he had that same bulge as well. Kristofferson felt his fur begin to tingle as his heart beat faster, getting excited, though he wasn't 100% sure why.

Looking back into Ash's face, Kristofferson finally saw Ash's eyes flutter open, still groggy and sleepy. He thought he saw a smile form on the corner of Ash's lips when they made eye contact, but he couldn't be sure.

"Mmmm," Ash moaned slightly, "good morning Kristofferson."

"Good morning, Ash," Kristofferson replied matter-of-factly, trying to hide his nervous excitement as best he could.

"How'd you sleep?"

The grey fox chuckled, unsure of quite how to answer that. "Uhhh..." he stuttered. "About as great as you, I guess." He motioned down to Ash's body.

"Wha...?" Ash hadn't noticed the changes yet, still in the process of waking up, but when he followed Kristofferson's gestures and saw the new muscles and bulges on his body, his eyes lit up. He instantly jolted upwards in bed, which caused him to whack his head on the ceiling.

"OWWW!" he cried out in pain. "What the cuss?" Rubbing his head, he looked upwards, stunned to see the substantial dent his head had left in the ceiling, which was much closer than he remembered it being just a few hours ago.

The pained seemed to disappear within a few seconds, however, and Ash's face quickly returned to one of excitement. Swinging his legs off the edge of the bed, he quickly jumped to the ground and stood to his full height. Even standing, his ears were brushing the ceiling, and looking down caused him to get a little dizzy due to how far away the ground looked. "Kris!" he exclaimed. "This is amazing! We're huge!!"

Kristofferson made his way off of the bed in a gentler manner than his cousin, standing to his full height, noticing that his head was pressing against the ceiling, still a few inches taller than Ash. Regardless, both young foxes were indeed much, much bigger than before -- a true sight to behold.

Ash walked over to the mirror on his wall, whistling when he got a good look at how his body now looked. "Wow," he grinned, "I'm even bigger and stronger than dad now!"

"That's an understatement," Kristofferson said. "Either of us could probably lift him clear off the ground with a single paw."

Ash continued to admire his body in the mirror, taking his arms and flexing as he posed. As he did so, a loud RIIIIPPP came from his underwear. Ash froze, realizing what had happened. Looking down, he sighed in relief when he saw that they were still staying on, if only barely.

Suddenly, there was a knock at the door. "Ash? Kristofferson?" The two boys recognized the voice of Mrs. Fox. "Are you boys up? It's breakfast time."

The doorknob began to jiggle, and the two boys stared in horror at it. "We can't let her see us like this," Ash said as he began to panic. "She'll freak out!"

"Well," Kristofferson whispered back, trying to maintain a calm composure, "what do you suggest we do?"

"Well," Ash shrugged, grinning slightly, "we grew a whole bunch, didn't we?"

”Yeah, but--” Kristofferson stopped, thinking this over. It sort of made sense that, if they grew because they ate the fruit, then the tree could grow bigger too. But this seemed sorta ridiculous. The roots in front of them filled up a large amount of space, and they seemed to be pulsating, almost as if they were slowly growing larger, right in front of their eyes. And who knew what the actual top half of the tree looked like.

”Hey!” Kristofferson yelled out as he realized something. ”If the roots are spread out down here, where's the actual tree? How are we going to get to the fruit?”

He and Ash looked around to try and find any clues. As they examined the walls, they noticed that the growing tree seemed to have put a lot of strain on them, causing some of the bricks to start crumbling and topple over. Closer into the center of the entangled roots, the ceiling seemed to have been pushed out of the way. The rest of the plant extended upwards, and they could make out a few rays of sunlight poking through.

”I think that's our answer,” Ash said as he pointed. ”I wonder if there's a way up there.”

”Ash! Wait!” Kristofferson cried out as Ash started to scamper up the roots towards the opening. Shaking his head, he followed after as fast as he could.

As they got closer to where the ceiling where the sunlight was seeping through, Kristofferson thought he heard the sound of a stream or river flowing close by, and he could definitely hear a couple of bird calls. ”Where exactly are we?” he wondered aloud.

”Only one way to find out,” Ash said. Pressing his paws against the ceiling, he pushed upwards with all his might, causing the ceiling to start crumbling again, forming an opening that was large enough for the two foxes to climb through. Dust and debris rained down on them, but nothing big enough to be more than an irritant.

”Geez, Ash,” Kristofferson smiled as he shook his head, ”try and be a little careful.”

Ignoring him, Ash climbed up through the opening he had formed, with Kristofferson following behind. The two foxes were amazed to see they were in a grotto of sorts, a place they had never seen before in all their exploration of the forest. As Kristofferson had guessed, a brook ran in between the trees, forming a small waterfall a little further down. In the middle, the formerly small tree from the sewer now towered overhead, significantly taller than any of the other trees in the area. What's more, it's branches seemed to be full of dozens, if not hundreds, of glowing fruits, many of which had fallen to the ground.

”Oh my god,” Ash said as he gawked up at the tree, and Kristofferson could only whistle in amazement. ”Kris,” Ash said, turning his head slightly but still keeping his eyes on the tree, ”are you thinking what I’m thinking?”

”Uh, what's that, Ash?”

”Um, maybe we should pace ourselves a bit, Ash,” Kristofferson said, nudging his cousin in the side with his elbow and chuckling. ”But still, I think we're both pretty hungry, aren't we?”

”What, you're already full?” Kristofferson made a ’tsk’ sound. ”I told you not to eat so much at breakfast.”

”Naw, I'm just ’pacing myself,’ like you said, Kris!” Ash sat down, leaning against the tree, and spread his legs out. He patted on the ground beside him, motioning for Kristofferson to join him, which he did. ”We can take a bit of a break, maybe nap a little, and then go for the taller fruit.”

Ash, on the other hand, was something far, far beyond a normal fox. He could help. He could do something! He could be a hero like the White Cape, and he'd really be helping someone in desperate need! As his shoulder smashed an oak tree to the side, leaving it leaning dramatically in the wake of his passage, he promised himself that he was going to learn first aid as soon as he could. He wouldn't make a very good superhero if he couldn't help anyone! The scream came again, he had to be almost there! They needed to know he was coming, that someone was on their way to rescue them! As his jaws parted, he only just realised that whoever he was about to save was almost definitely a human. The irony wasn't lost on him. However, before he could think about it further, another scream rang out, but this was no cry for help. It was a scream of pain.

They were absolutely terrified of him, and frankly, it sent a rush of smug satisfaction through him as he realised that these fearsome predators, these powerful canines, who were so much bigger than your typical fox, were all utterly terrified of him. For good reason, standing at sixty feet tall, with a weight that he couldn't even begin to guess that left his paws sinking into the mud, and musculature so impressive he actually entertained the thought that it might be able to cut granite. He put on his own snarl, to which the wolves quickly backed up.

On the outside anyway. He knew enough that you shouldn't move anyone with a head, neck or back injury, but given the situation, he had to. He might stop breathing with all that mud around his face. Hey, hey, it's okay. Look, how about we go out and take a look for them?" He suggested. His tone was full of confidence, but she could tell that he was as afraid as she was.

She let out a shaky breath, nodding slowly. "Okay. Okay, that sounds... that sounds like a good idea. I can't bear the thought of just sitting around while the boys might be in trouble!" She exclaimed, to which Foxy took a hold of her paws in his.

1352112121121222221121222211.content:
As far as Felicity was concerned, she had performed an admirable job in maintaining her composure throughout this ordeal. However, it was becoming increasingly difficult to maintain said composure on account of both the increasing length of time it had been since she'd last seen them and, more pressingly, the extraordinarily large pawprints they were walking alongside. While the prints had been cast out of sheer force in the mud before - that type of soil had been so wet it was less soil and more muddy water, so those six foot deep prints were likely very misleading, or so she hoped - these prints had been cast from mud. However, the constant movement of travelling had clearly allowed for some of that mud to be transferred, so while the prints had been perfectly clear at the beginning, they had become less and less visible, up until right now, where it was difficult to see even a trace of the prints, even when looking closely. Unable to keep quiet anymore, she spoke up and voiced her concerns to her husband. "Foxy... are you sure the boys are alright? I mean... I don't understand why these prints could possibly be so huge... and why were they exploring the ruins of that old factory?" She asked uneasily, to which Foxy promptly replied in a reassuring tone. "Don't worry dear, I'm sure there's a perfectly good reason! Like I said, we'll just have to find it. It's no good guessing, but the boys must surely have their reasons. Like the factory, I'm sure they just wanted to have a look around and explore, they were probably just curious!" He smiled, although this only eased her fears for the factory, leaving her baffled concerns regarding the prints still unanswered.

With a quiet sigh and a small shake of her head, Felicity ultimately decided to take her husband's advice and did her best to put her fears to one side. He was right, guessing wasn't going to get them anywhere fast. On the contrary, if anything, it was only going to slow them down. Plus, it was only going to get her more and more anxious about everything, and that most definitely wasn't going to help anyone. No, it was best to try and stay calm and just follow the trail. Well, the road, in this case, given that most of the prints were only barely visible now. Thankfully, the road only went in one direction - there had been no turn offs, no crossroads or T-junctions, no side roads, nothing of the sort. So figuring out where exactly the boys could have gone was not exactly difficult. Especially given that there was no indication that the boys had gone off the beaten track. There were no disturbances in the vegetation or anything like that. Even better, while she couldn't be exactly sure until she got closer, it looked like the road turned off ahead.

That... was a good sign. Or at least, she certainly hoped so. It would be cruel to have her hopes raised only for them to be so promptly shattered. Sparing a glance in her husband's direction, she noted that although he had remained silent, he was clearly as hopeful as she was. She could see it. The signs were subtle, but they were there. The twitch of his whiskers. The look in his eyes. The twitching of his fingertips as they approached ever closer. She could only hope she was right. Hopefully the boys were there.

They would finally get some answers too, like what was up with these bizarre prints all over the place? Why on earth had the boys felt in necessary to make such extraordinarily large prints? For that matter, how did they make those prints in the first place? Why had they been exploring that factory when it was in such poor shape? Why hadn't they come home yet? No, no, don't think about that too much. Panicking would only make things worse for everyone. Now would be a terrible time to get all worked up into hysterics. Besides, they were about to find out. Hopefully. But they had to be here. Their scents led down this path. They were faint, certainly, masked by the smell of farmlands, but it was there. They must have been nearby. Surely?

Pushing her concerns to the wayside for now, she pressed on alongside Foxy, her paws moving along the rough dirt path with a determined speed. As she rounded the bend, however, her gait slowed to a stop, her eyes widening as a thrill of panic struck her. As Foxy stopped in tandem, she couldn't help but voice her alarm. "Foxy! It's a farm!" She cried, grasping his arm as she pointed to the sign with her other paw. He took her paw in his gently, speaking with a reassuring tone.

"Now, now, it's okay honey. It looks bad, but we can't assume the worst. The boys could be entirely fine. We have to have hope." He said gently but firmly, to which she nodded slowly.

"O-okay... but we have to be careful. Who knows what the humans living here are like?" She replied, to which he nodded.

"Of course, honey. We're not going to rush in, we'll take it nice and slowly." Foxy said confidently, before they quickly rushed ahead, rising over the small incline of the road before they stopped in their tracks as they beheld an incredible sight.

For a long moment, neither fox moved an inch, standing there, stock still as their brains sluggishly attempted to process what their eyes were seeing, trying to reject it, or rationalise it for how completely impossible it seemed, but unable to do either with how undeniably real it was. There, across from the shattered ruins of what looked like some sort of barn or other such structure, sitting some distance away from them, with what was unmistakably a human in his paw, was Kristofferson. He was almost unrecognisable. Towering far above their heads like some sort of titan, Kristofferson was easily several times the height of the farmhouse, and that was only made even more impressive considering he was sitting cross-legged on the ground. His height most definitely was not the only way in which he had grown, however. His formerly slender, if toned, frame had filled out with enough muscle to easily bump him up into the range that was probably pushing the upper limits of heavyweight and approaching the lower limits for super-heavyweight. His eight-pack abdominals were set in a solid cobblestone grid just below a pair of pectorals that barrelled out several inches. Nothing but pure, solid muscle. His limbs had not been spared any growth, however, with his biceps easily rivalling the size of his pectorals, his calves easily several times the size of fully-grown members of their namesake. He was an absolutely hulking beast of a giant.

"Foxy?" Felicity spoke, in a voice that was barely a whisper. She was so stunned she could barely even recognise the voice as her own. She felt... like everything around her was slightly transparent, as if it wasn't all quite real. Like some sort of... facsimile. A fake version of reality, almost as if she was dreaming. "Is that..." She began to ask before trailing off, unwilling to ask the question out loud, as if it might break some sort of illusion. As if the sight before her might become true. She'd wanted to know if Kristofferson was safe, and he so very clearly was, but... he was enormous! He'd turned into some kind of giant! Was he okay? Had this hurt him? Would it hurt him? How was he feeling? What had caused this? There were so many questions... still, at least she now had answers to some of the earlier questions. That was why they had made such huge prints... and no wonder they felt comfortable going into the ruined factory, with how huge he was. But where was Ash?! Was he okay? Had the same thing happened to him as well, or was he still as he always had been? There were still so many questions! "Kristofferson..." Foxy breathed, jolting her back to reality. There was no denying it. It was Kristofferson.

Sparing a quick glance in Foxy's direction, she took a few tentative steps forward, her pulse picking up as her paws padded over the rough terrain of the path. She thought she heard Foxy say something, but if he did, he stopped himself partway through. He quickly rushed to join her as the two of them began to walk up towards their nephew who now towered over not only them, but their very home, and even the homes of humans! "Kristofferson!" She called out to him. His ears perked up instantly, his tail lifting up in surprise at the sudden voice. Both he and the human held aloft in his paw whipped around to see the pair of them walking up the path, his expression slipping into what could only be described as a mixture of dumbfounded shock, alarm, embarrassment, and... a little bit of confidence and relief too as the human said something that she couldn't quite hear, to which Kristofferson replied with a response in the affirmative.

"Ah! Uh... hey! Uh... you, uh... I see... I see you can, well, see me..." He murmured quietly, diverting his gaze, to which Foxy gave a weak chuckle before letting out a whistle.

"Well, uh, it's kind of hard not to Kristofferson..." He trailed off, gesturing to his enormous, muscular body with a sweeping gesture. The silver fox shook his head.

"Ah, I'll explain that later. For now, I guess you've got a lot of questions, huh?"

Upon hearing this Kris couldn't help but cringe a bit despite his truly gigantic size knowing that his aunt might be cross with him. Though when he looked down he found himself letting out a mental sigh of relief when he saw his Uncle place a hand onto the female fox's shoulder before he chined in with, "What your Aunt is trying to say is that we'd like for you to start at the beginning. Like how and when did this happen?"

When he heard this the sliver furred fox nodded his head in understanding as he explained, "Well um both Ash and I went exploring down in the sewers one day and we well, we kind of ran into this really odd tree that had some oddly shaped fruit on it. And even though I told Ash that we should leave alone he brought back home with us any way and we both ate some of it." The giant anthro then used his free hand to mentoin to his body as he went on with, "And well that's how it started since we woke and saw that we had gained some muscle night and were a little bit taller too. Then after breakfast we went back to the tree and ate some more of the fruit. That's when we took a nap and when we woke up we saw that we had grown again and we knew we couldn't fit in the sewers."

"Ah, so that's why you both asked if you stay a t friends place is that it?" Foxy questioned, now with a hand underneath his chin.

"R-Right...." Kris let out, as he did his best not to blush out of embarrassment for what he was going to say next. Though after swallowing a lump in his throat he added, "That's was actually after we found that factory and took everything out of it and slept in there for the night.... Though by the morning we ended up growing again..."

"And I take it that's when you ran into that young lady who is your massive paw right now?" The older male fox asked, to which Kris blushed a bit darker now.

"Y-Yes, though to be fair we didn't run into her. It was well more like she found us after passing by the factory. And after that happened she was nice enough to let both Ash and I stay on her famr here with her since she's lived alone here for quite a few years now." The blue eyed fox said, before he carefully set the human down the ground. And upon doing so he kept on going with, "Uncle Foxy, Aunt Felicity, this is Rebecca. Rebecca, this Ash's parents."

The giant fox watched with baited breathe as the young woman pushed some of her hair behind one of her ears before she let out, "It's um very nice to meet you both. Though I'm sorry that both of you had to find your nephew in this state. I've been trying to find a way to turn him back to normal. ...Though I haven't found any sort of major lead as of yet that can reverse it."

"It's very nice to meet you Rebecca. Thank you for looking after our nephew." Foxy responded back, with a soft smile on his face.

"Yes, thank you dear. But where's Ash?" Felicity asked, while she looked from left to right to find her son.

"Um well I'm sorry to say that he decided to leave a while ago...." The blonde haired young woman replied, saddness clear in her voice.

"What? He left? By why would he do that?...." Ash's mother asked, fear and worry in her voice.

"I um well I'm afraid it's my fault since I wasn't expecting them to have another growth spurt when they got here..... And he well....he outgrow my family's barn." Becky confessed, while she turned away not wanting to see the hurt looks on the other two foxes faces.

To her surprise however, after saying this she felt one of Kris's giant fingers gentle rub her back when he told her, "No Rebecca, it wasn't your fault at all." The sliver fox then looked down at his Aunt and Uncle again when he added, "Ash pretty much was acting like a total jerk and didn't even apologize for what he did. So he and I had an argument. And.....he deiced to leave."

"What? He went into the forest! But if he....he....." Felicity began, before she started to break down a little.

This did cause Kris to look away not wanting to see his Aunt like this. Though thankfully his Uncle was on top of situation as he told her, "Now dear, there's no need to worry. If Ash is nearby as big as Kris is then he should be fine out there on his own."

But Foxy we have to go after him!" The female fox pleaded.

"And we will dear." The older fox replied, as he held his wife in his arms. Kris then saw him look up at him when he continued, "So Kris, which way did Ash walk off to after you two had your argument?"

Upon hearing this the giant fox pointed away from the farmhouse and said, "He went that way, Uncle."

To this the older male fox nodded his head and started to guide his wife away from the young human woman and the giant sized Kris. Though the sliver furred fox couldn't help but worry about his Aunt since he had no idea how'd handle seeing her son being so massive fi she had a hard time handling what happened to him and he was only his nephew.

But once the two foxes were completely gone from sigh t Kris let out a very heavy sigh and wonder what would happen next. As it so happens...........
